Package org.ro.tuc.pt.businessLayer

Class ProductsOperations

java.lang.Object
org.ro.tuc.pt.businessLayer.ProductsOperations
public class ProductsOperations
extends java.lang.Object
This class will be used for managing product operations. It reads from and writes to the product table in the database.

    Creates a new instance of ProductsOperations.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProductsOperations

      public ProductsOperations​(ConnectionFactory connectionFactory, MainFrame mainFrame)
      Creates a new instance of ProductsOperations.
      Parameters:
      connectionFactory - is the object holding the connection to the database.
      mainFrame - is the main window of the application, which will have to be updated in this class when client changes are made.

  • Method Details

    • getProducts

      public java.util.ArrayList<Product> getProducts()
      Returns:
      the list of the application's currently existing products.

    • getProductByID

      public Product getProductByID​(int id)
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the product we want to find.
      Returns:
      reference to an object of type Product if the id is found, or null if the id is not found.

    • updateProduct

      public void updateProduct​(Product product)
      it updates the data specific to a product in the database and in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      product - the Product that will be updated.

    • validateProduct

      public int validateProduct​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String price, java.lang.String stock)
      Validates the input provided by the user when trying to edit/add a product. If the input is correct, it edits/inserts the new product and makes the neccessary updates in the GUI and in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - provided a valid integer (not user input but generated by the application).
      name - checked to be not empty.
      price - checked to be not empty and be a valid float value.
      stock - checked to be not empty and be a valid integer value.
      Returns:
      -1 if the input is correct and the updates were made, 0 if the name is incorrect, 1 if the price is incorrect, 2 if the stock is incorrect.

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct​(int id)
      Deletes the product from the application and makes the updates in the GUI and database.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the product that will be deleted, provided it is a valid id.

    • getNewID

      public int getNewID()
      Returns:
      the id that will be assigned to the next product introduced into the database.
